data.title: Lesotho
data.meta_description: Comprehensive destination guide to Lesotho with tips and advice on things to see and do, ways to save money and help to plan your trip.
data.text:
For a first-time visit to Lesotho, it's recommended to base yourself in Maseru, the capital city, as it provides easy access to major attractions, cultural experiences, and amenities. Here's why:

Where To Stay In Maseru:

Maseru is the largest city and the capital of Lesotho, offering a blend of urban conveniences and cultural attractions amidst the beautiful landscapes of the country. Explore attractions like the Royal Palace, Thaba-Bosiu Cultural Village, and Maseru Mall for shopping and dining.

Budget: Blue Crane B&B offers affordable accommodations with clean rooms and basic amenities, located in a quiet area close to the city center.

Mid-range: Avani Maseru Hotel provides comfortable rooms and modern facilities with a central location near major landmarks and government offices.

Luxury: AVANI Lesotho Hotel & Casino offers luxurious accommodations with upscale amenities, including a casino, spa, and outdoor pool.

Tip: Consider visiting Lesotho during the dry season (April to October) for pleasant weather and clear skies, and book accommodations in advance, especially during popular events like the Morija Arts & Cultural Festival.

Additionally, for those interested in exploring Lesotho's natural beauty and outdoor adventures, consider staying in the following regions:

Where To Stay In Semonkong:

Semonkong is a small town located in the central part of Lesotho, known for its stunning landscapes, including the Maletsunyane Falls, one of the highest single-drop waterfalls in Africa.

Budget: Semonkong Lodge offers affordable accommodations with rustic charm and a range of outdoor activities, including pony trekking and hiking.

Mid-range: Maliba Lodge provides comfortable chalets and lodge rooms with scenic views of the surrounding mountains and easy access to outdoor adventures.

Luxury: Semonkong Lodge also offers luxury accommodations in their River Lodge, featuring spacious rooms, private decks, and panoramic views of the waterfall.
